main_definition: The first month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, typically associated with new beginnings and resolutions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Symbol of new beginnings or fresh starts
meanings_and_examples.example: As the first month of the year, January represents a time to set goals and start afresh for the coming year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Time period between December 31st and February 28th/29th in non-leap years or leap years
meanings_and_examples.example: The holiday season typically ends on January 1st, marking the start of a new year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Historical reference to Roman Emperor Gaius Caesar Augustus Germanicus (commonly known as Caligula)
meanings_and_examples.example: Some people say they can't stand January because it reminds them of the chaos associated with the reign of Caligula.
